Rao’s Spaghetti with Broken Meatball Marinara Recipe | Bon Appetit




















































Close Menu IconLoginRecipesCookingCultureShoppingRestaurantsBA MarketVideosPodcastSubscribe to our newsletterSign UpPrivacy and user agreementMain Navigation IconBA LogoBon appetitLoginSPONSOREDRao’s Spaghetti with Broken Meatball MarinaraSponsored by Rao’s Homemade®FacebookPinterestTwitterEmail(Binary data 20 bytes, use -b option to extract)PrintIngredients1 slice artisan white bread (1 ounce)1/4 whole milk1 pound ground beef1/3 cup fresh parsley leaves, finely chopped, plus more for optional garnish¼ cup fresh basil leaves, finely chopped, plus more for optional garnish1/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan1 large egg2 garlic cloves, finely gratedKosher salt and freshly ground black pepper3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil¾ pound Rao’s spaghetti1 jar (24 ounce) Rao’s Marinara sauceRecipe PreparationIn a large bowl, combine the bread and milk and let sit for a few minutes. Using your hands, squeeze milk out of the bread and discard the milk. Tear the bread into pea-size or smaller pieces and return to the bowl. Add the beef, parsley, basil parmesan, egg, garlic, 1 teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon black pepper. Stir to combine and form into 16 meatballs.Heat a large high-sided skillet, preferably enameled cast iron, over medium-high. Add the oil and swirl to coat. Arrange the meatballs in the skillet in a single layer and cook, until well browned on the first side, 3 minutes. Then, turn meatballs, no need to be super gently, allow them to break up slightly. Continue to cook, turning a few times, until mostly crisp and golden on the outside, about 10 minutes more. Pour the marinara into the skillet with the meatballs and gently stir to combine.Meanwhile, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the spaghetti per package instructions until al dente. Drain and transfer to the pot with the meatballs and sauce. Toss to coat and serve with more parm & a sprinkling of parsley and basil, if desired.Sponsored by Rao’s Homemade®GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for the Bon AppétitNewsletterSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyExplore Bon AppétitRao’s Homemade®PastaMeatballItalian AmericanGround BeefSpaghettiMainNut-FreeDinnerMore from Bon AppétitRecipes6 Pro Chefs Reveal Their "Secret Weapon" Ingredients2022-03-02T17:00:00.000ZrecipePorcini Gnocchi With Butter Sauce2022-03-15T09:00:00.000ZrecipeWhiskey Sour2020-12-16T18:20:00.000ZBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
